alert.note: Alert for Albany; Carbon; Converse (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 26 at 5:24PM MDT until July 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Carbon County in south central Wyoming... Central Albany County in southeastern Wyoming... Southwestern Converse County in east central Wyoming... * Until 600 PM MDT. * At 520 PM MDT, outflow wind gusts from severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 14 miles north of Rolling Hills to near Boxelder to 6 miles southwest of Garrett to 10 miles north of Lake Hattie Reservoir, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Severe wind gusts reported east of Casper and along I-80 west of Laramie. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Laramie, Douglas, Glenrock, Rolling Hills, Rock River, Rolling Hills Estates, Bosler, Esterbrook, Friend Park Campground, Curtis Gulch Campground, Laramie Peak, Esterbrook Campground, Laprele Reservoir, Windy Peak, Deer Creek, Garrett, Boxelder, Wheatland Reservoir 3, Campbell Creek Campground and Little Medicine School. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 131 and 174. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 269 and 309. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
